name: Pocketjs
body:
### It's not the library you deserve, it's the library you need.
A lot of websites load the entire jQuery library, yet only use a subset of the available methods. PocketJS combines some of the most heavily used jQuery DOM methods into a tiny "pocket-sized" 1KB file. (Legal Disclaimer: 1kb AFTER minification. Not guaranteed to fit in your pocket.)

### Installation
To use, simply include the script anywhere on your page:
```
  <script src="pocket.min.js"></script>
```

### Usage
A list of available methods and example usages of each is located on [Github](https://github.com/callmeaponte/pocketJS).

### Authors and Contributors
In 2014, Andrew Aponte authored the ridiculously amazingly awesome PocketJS library.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with PocketJS? Check out the [documentation](https://github.com/callmeaponte/pocketJS) or message me @callmeaponte.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
